Submodules¶

tchelper.configr module¶

class tchelper.configr.Configr¶

Bases: object

Wrapper for configparser

Class that acts as an interface to the configparser library for tcHelper.

Variables

config_file_location – The location of the config.ini file which by default should reside in the root directory of tcHelper.py.

change_value(section, key, value)¶

Method for changing the key of an option in config.ini.

Use change_value() when you need to edit an option in config.ini

Parameters

  • section – The section within config.ini that contain the option to be changed.

  • key – The within the section option that is to be changed.

  • value – The value for the option that will be written.

Variables

config_loc – Holds the location for the config.ini file on the user’s drive.

Example

Section

Key

Value

DB

location

/foo/database.thd

 
>>> config = Configr()
>>> config.change_value('DB', 'location', '/foo/config.ini')
>>> config.get_value('DB', 'location')
'/foo/config.ini'
config_file_location = 'config.ini'¶
static file_exist(loc='config.ini')¶

Test to make sure the file exists and is not write protected.

Tests to make sure the file exists and can be written to. If the file does not exists or can’t be access, possibly due to write protection the method will display an error and exit completely.

Parameters

loc (str) – location for the database. Defaults to the config_file_location if no arguments are passed.

Returns

Return ‘True’ if file exists and isn’t write protected.

Return type

Bool

get_value(section, key)¶

Return the value of a key in config.ini.

Use get_value() when you want to get the key for an option from config.ini.

Parameters

  • section (str) – The section within config.ini.

  • key (str) – The key of a section that its value will be returned.

Returns

Returns the value for the key.

Return type

str

Example

Section

Key

Value

DB

location

/foo/database.thd

 
>>> config = Configr()
>>> config.change_value('DB', 'location', '/foo/database.thd')
>>> config.get_value('DB', 'location')
'/foo/database.thd'

tchelper.db module¶

class tchelper.db.DB¶

Bases: object

The DB module provides an interface to the project’s SQLite3 database.

Variables

db_location – The location of the database as recorded in the config.ini file.

add_item(table, column, value)¶

Takes an item and adds it to the database.

The column and value strings must be placed in a tuple.

Example

>>> item = DB()
>>> item.add_item('Table_name', ('col1', 'col2'), ('val1', 'val2')

Table_Name

col1

col2

row 1

val1

val2

Known Problems: The value list that is passed into the method is automatically converted into a string regardless if it’s another data type such as an int, float, or bool.

Parameters

  • table – The table that will be written to.

  • column – The column(s) that will be passed to the database.

  • value – The value(s) that will be passed to the database.

commit_sql(sql)¶

Takes the SQL commands and commits it to SQLite

Parameters

sql – the SQL command that needs to be passed to SQLite.

count_rows(table, visible=True)¶

Return the total number of rows in a table.

Return the total number if entries, or rows, in a table.

Parameters

  • table (str) – The table that needs to be counted.

  • visible (bool) – Determines if only visible items are counted. The default only counts visible entries in the table.

Returns

The total number of rows in the table.

Return type

int

static db_init()¶

Initialize a new SQLite database.

Method to initialize a new database. This method can be invoked when tcHelper runs for the first time or when a new database needs to be created. The db_init() method does not take any arguments and returns nothing.

db_location = 'did not update'¶
delete_data()¶

Method to delete record from the database.

Records are never really deleted from the database. Instead records are marked as Visiable: False.

Note

Method has not been implemented.

static get_path()¶

Returns the path of the database located in config.ini

Returns

Returns the path to the database as listed in config.ini.

Return type

str

modify_item(table, column, value, row_id)¶

Modifies an item in the database.

Parameters

  • table (str) – The table to be modified.

  • column (list) – The column being modified.

  • value (list) – The value being modified.

  • row_id (int) – The row in the database being modified.

return_item(table, row_id)¶

Returns a specific item from the database.

Parameters

  • table – The table the data resides in.

  • row_id (int) – The ID of the item being retrieved.

return_pass_sql(sql)¶

Returns the item the user requested.

Warning

This method will be replaced with return_sql()

Parameters

sql – the SQL code that is passed to return_sql()

return_sql(sql)¶

Returns data from the SQLite database.

Parameters

sql – the SQL command to pass to SQLite

Return data

returns a list with each row in a tuple.
